topic: How to type-check notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to type-check notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Type-Checking Notebooks for Production Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This explainer will guide you through the process of type-checking Jupyter notebooks to ensure they are production-ready using FastAPI in Python 3.12+. We'll cover key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.",

  "key_points": [
    "Convert Jupyter Notebooks to FastAPI applications for type-checking",
    "Install necessary packages like `fastapi`, `uvicorn`, `pydantic`, and `jupyter_client`",
    "Use the `@app.post("/notebook")` decorator in FastAPI to create an endpoint for your notebook",
    "Access Jupyter kernel objects and execute cells through the API",
    "Implement type-checking and validation using Pydantic Models"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
import fastapi as fa\n\
from pydantic import BaseModel\n\
from fastapi.responses import JSONResponse\n\
from IPython.kernel import kernelmanager\n\
\n\
app = fa.FastAPI()\n\
\n\
@app.post('/notebook')\n\
async def run_notebook(data: NotebookData):\n    with kernelmanager.find_kernel('jupyter') as km:\n        km.execute_cells(data.cells)\n        return JSONResponse({'status': 'success'})\n\n\
class NotebookData(BaseModel):\n    cells: list[str]```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python version: 3.12+",
    "FastAPI: >=0.65.0",
    "Pydantic: >=1.8.2",
    "Jupyter Client: >=5.3.4"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Converting notebooks to FastAPI applications may require refactoring for best practices and readability.",
    "Type-checking will only apply to cells that are executed through the API, not all cells in the notebook.",
    "Make sure to test your API thoroughly to ensure proper functionality."
  ]
}
